author: dlr
msg: * notes/merge-tracking.txt: Improve cyclic merging task description.

author: hwright
msg: Followup to r25314: Move the definition of log_tree_node to the top of the
file, where it is visible for the declaration of do_logs().
Found by: markphip
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(log_tree_node): Move definition to the top of the file.

author: hwright
msg: When running 'svn log -g', properly trace merged revisions to the correct path,
and use this information when building log message trees.
Note: This patch greatly increases functionality, but could still use a bit of
refactoring for style, cleanliness and memory usage.  This is in some ways a
checkpoint commit.  (That's what version control is for, after all! :) )
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(send_log_tree): Clear a subpool.
(find_merge_source): New function.
(do_logs): New log worker function.  Largely factored out of
svn_repos_get_logs4().
(build_log_tree):  Lookup the merge source for each merged revision, and
use that source to build children of the merging revision.
(svn_repos_get_logs4): Factor a large amount into do_logs().
* subversion/tests/cmdline/log_tests.py
(simple_merge_sensitive_log): Remove a bogus revision from the expected merge
results.

author: hwright
msg: Fix a bug with log message nesting.  Don't pop the stack frame of the parent
until all the children have been received.
* subversion/svn/log-cmd.c
(log_message_receiver): Decrement the children remaining counter in the
current frame, but don't pop it until all of the current child's children
have been received.

author: markphip
msg: JavaHL: Follow-up to r25307,25308.  Add simple tests of scenario where
getMergeInfo() and getCopySource() return null objects.
[ in subversion/bindings/javahl/tests/org/tigris/subversion/javahl ]
* BasicTests.java
(testBasicCopy): Added a call to getCopySource() on path that has not
been copied to verify it returns a null object.
(testBasicMerge): Added a call to getMergeInfo() on path with no mergeinfo
to verify that it returns a null object.
